importantArticles.headline: Dividend stocks are a blessing to investors because they provide income and don't rely on stock price appreciation to reward shareholders.  You can't go wrong with dividend payouts at any time, but they're especially helpful when there's a lot of uncertainty in the stock market.  If you want investment income without worrying too much about stock price movements, the following two dividend stocks are worth adding to your stock portfolio.
importantArticles.title: The 2 Smartest Dividend Stocks to Buy Right Now

importantArticles.headline: Coca-Cola (NYSE: KO) stock gained 15% in the first quarter of the year, according to data provided by S&P Global Market Intelligence.  As the market absorbed the possibility of a new tariff program, investors moved toward safe stocks like Coca-Cola.  While the market tumbled yesterday with the full news of the new program, Coca-Cola stock zoomed even higher.
importantArticles.title: Why Coca-Cola Stock Jumped 15% in the First Quarter of 2025

importantArticles.headline: Coca-Cola (NYSE: KO) and PepsiCo (NASDAQ: PEP) have a long-standing rivalry as each has battled for the hearts, minds, and wallets of consumers.  Stock analysis may not have the entertainment value of the companies' commercials, but which one, Coca-Cola or PepsiCo, deserves your investment dollars?  Coca-Cola started selling its namesake brand in 1886, and it remains a pure beverage company.
importantArticles.title: Best Stock to Buy Right Now: Coca-Cola vs. PepsiCo
